column5: A couple years ago we had an inflatable slide for the pool, but after about a year and a half it got a few leaks and we had to toss it. But it did have 2 air chambers on the sides that were still fine, so we carefully cut them off and set them aside since it looked like it could be useful.  So this spring I remembered about them, I went out, bought a lawn chair, carried it on my back a couple kilometres from canadian tire, drilled some holes, cut the legs, filed the edges and strapped the pontoons on. Just took it for a test ride in the pool and it handles well and it very comfortable  Brian and Terry don't have nothin on me! LOL
Pure win Way to go Chris! A pair of flippers and your good to go!!!!
ha ha, nice work. Now all you need is an apron for your line and a cupholder
there has to be a redneck joke  for that some where  but I like it
Awesome!!! It looks more comfortable than my float tubes.
Red Green would shed a tear if he saw that! Actually looks pretty good
Where's the trolling motor mount?   Seriously - nice work!  Real inventive mind you have there Chris.  Hope it brings you many hours and days of catching.  Michael
Dragons Den here comes Christopher.  Christopher, when do you have time to do your homework? Or have you already graduated University?
All it needs is a clamp on umbrella and a drink holder. Nice work
